turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I'm ready to start processing these medical bills. I have a stack here from last week that needs to be submitted to insurance.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Great! To begin, please upload the batch of bills. Ensure they are in a compatible format like PDF or TIFF. Alternatively, you can enter the details manually if preferred.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, PDFs again? Fine, uploading now... It's taking forever! This internet is killing me. Okay, uploaded.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. The system is now processing the documents. You will receive a notification when the data extraction is complete.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Alright, got the notification. It says two claims have errors. One is missing a diagnosis code, and the other has an invalid procedure code. What do I do now?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: You can correct the errors by clicking on each claim individually and editing the fields directly. For the missing diagnosis code, consult the patient's medical record or the physician's notes. For the invalid procedure code, please cross-reference it with the appropriate coding guidelines, such as CPT or HCPCS, to ensure accuracy.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I fixed those. But...what if the physician legitimately used an 'unlisted' procedure code? It happens sometimes when they do something really novel. How do I handle that?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: For unlisted procedure codes, you'll need to manually submit a paper claim with detailed documentation. This should include a cover letter explaining the procedure, the reason for using an unlisted code, supporting medical records, and a comparison to similar procedures with established codes. Our system can flag the claim for manual submission and generate the necessary forms for you to print and mail. Note that reimbursement is not guaranteed and depends on the payer's policies and review.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that's...helpful, I guess. A little complicated, but helpful. So, after everything is corrected, what's the final step to submit to insurance?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Once all errors are resolved, click the 'Submit All' button. The system will electronically transmit the claims to the respective insurance payers. You'll receive confirmation numbers for each submission.
